expl: the light was filtered through a soft glass window
light.n.01.defn: (physics) electromagnetic radiation that can produce a visual sensation

expl: he stopped the car and turned off the lights
light.n.02.defn: any device serving as a source of illumination

expl: although he saw it in a different light, he still did not understand
light.n.03.defn: a particular perspective or aspect of a situation

expl: its luminosity is measured relative to that of our sun
luminosity.n.01.defn: the quality of being luminous; emitting or reflecting light

light.n.06.defn: a condition of spiritual awareness; divine illumination

expl: he could paint the lightest light and the darkest dark
light.n.07.defn: the visual effect of illumination on objects or scenes as created in pictures

expl: they played as long as it was light
as long as the lighting was good
can you shed light on this problem?
light.n.10.defn: mental understanding as an enlightening experience

expl: he had a sparkle in his eye
there's a perpetual twinkle in his eyes
sparkle.n.01.defn: merriment expressed by a brightness or gleam or animation of countenance

expl: it brought the scandal to light

inner_light.n.01.defn: a divine presence believed by Quakers to enlighten and guide the soul

expl: they saw the light of the beacon
there was a light at every corner

lighter.n.02.defn: a device for lighting or igniting fuel or charges or fires

expl: his no was loud and clear

nobelium.n.01.defn: a radioactive transuranic element synthesized by bombarding curium with carbon ions; 7 isotopes are known
